pwfengine

PWF Engine

PWF Engine is the engine of the PWF framework, used to create web wrappers based on generic schemas.

Let's suppose you want to navigate a page of a website to extract some information from it. The first thing you have to is to create the engine class specifying the schemas root directory: 

PEngine *engine = new PEngine();
engine->setSchemasCandidatesDirectory("schemas/");
See also:
PEngine

Now you can create the site wrapper passing the engine to it: 

PSiteWrapper *myWrapper = new PSiteWrapper(engine);
myWrapper->setUrl("http://www.sitename.com/");
See also:
PSiteWrapper

Now the critical part: setting a schema. You have two choices:

  • Automatically detect the schema, use this if you don't know what is the specific schema but you have a list of possible candidates. 
    PAction *schemaAction = myWrapper->detectSchema();
    In this case you have only an idea of the site content, e.g. a forum, but you have schemas for the various kinds, e.g. one for phpbb, one for smf, etc., so you let the system detects the right schema for you.
  • Set the schema manually: 
    PAction *schemaAction = myWrapper->setSchema("smf");
    In this case you already know that the site is an smf forum and so matches the schema written for it.

Obviously, these are only some examples of schema usages, (ideally) you could model a generic schema that apply to all forums!
